answerText: Lyman alpha[10] More generally, this law describes the x-rays emitted by atoms for the n=2 to the n=1 state. Its British formulator died in World War I, but his law helped bring acceptance to the Bohr model.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 3 | 2 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This transition series for hydrogen gives its name to a "forest" emitted by galaxies and quasars. For 10 points each: [10] Name this transition from the n=2 state to the n=1 state.
